get.description: Get details of a cart linked to a specific customer using a unique cart ID. It offers an overview of the items, quantities, prices, and other relevant information associated with the cart.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the cart.

parameters.name: i
parameters.description: Select `true` to retrieve all the items added in the cart.

parameters.name: b
parameters.description: Select `true` to retrieve the price breakup of cart items.

parameters.name: c
parameters.description: Select `true` to retrieve the cod charges in breakup of cart items.

parameters.name: assign_card_id
parameters.description: Token of user's debit or credit card.

parameters.name: area_code
parameters.description: Customer servicable area_code.

parameters.name: buy_now
parameters.description: Select `true` to set/initialize buy now cart.

parameters.name: order_type
parameters.description: The order type of shipment HomeDelivery - If the customer wants the order home-delivered PickAtStore - If the customer wants the handover of an order at the store itself.

200.description: Success. Returns a Cart object. Check the example shown below or refer `CartDetailResult` for more details.

head.summary: getCartLastModified | Get last modified timestamp of a cart
head.description: Retrieve the last modified timestamp of the cart using unique cart ID. It indicates the most recent update made to the cart's content or properties.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the cart.

200.description: Success. Receives last modifed timestamp in the header.

get.summary: getAddresses | Get a list of addresses for a customer
get.description: List all addresses saved by the customer, simplifying the checkout process by offering pre-saved address options for delivery.

parameters.name: cart_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the user cart.

parameters.name: buy_now
parameters.description: Whether to get buy_now cart.

parameters.name: mobile_no
parameters.description: Mobile number of the customer.

parameters.name: checkout_mode
parameters.description: Option to checkout for self or for others.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Tag given to an address, e.g. work, home, office, shop.

parameters.name: is_default
parameters.description: Select `true` to fetch the default address.

200.description: Success. Returns an Address object containing a list of address saved in the account. Refer `GetAddressesResult` for more details.

post.summary: addAddress | Creates a new address for a customer
post.description: Add a new address to their cart to save details such as name, email, contact information, and address.

requestBody.description: Add address details in the request body as shown below or refer `Address` for more details.

200.description: Success. Returns the address ID, a flag whether the address is set as default, and a success message. Refer `SaveAddressResult` for more details.

422.description: Maximum limit for user addresses has been exceeded.

value.message: You have reached the limit of 20 addresses. Please edit or delete an existing address to add a new one.

get.summary: getAddressById | Get details for a single customer address
get.description: Get a specific customer address stored in the system by providing its unique identifier. This API provides detailed information about the address, including the recipient's name, address, city, postal code, and other relevant details.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID allotted to the selected address.

parameters.name: cart_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the cart.

parameters.name: buy_now
parameters.description: This is boolean to get buy_now cart.

parameters.name: mobile_no
parameters.description: Mobile number of the customer.

parameters.name: checkout_mode
parameters.description: Option to checkout for self or for others.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Tag given to an address, e.g. work, home, office, shop.

parameters.name: is_default
parameters.description: This is a boolean value. Select `true` to fetch the default address.

200.description: Success. Returns an Address object containing a list of address saved in the account. Refer `Address` for more details.

put.summary: updateAddress | Updates an existing customer address

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID allotted to the selected address.

requestBody.description: Add address details in the request body as shown below or refer `Address` for more details.

201.description: Success. Returns the address ID and a message indicating a successful address updation.

delete.description: Delete an existing customer address from the system.

get.description: Validate the applicability of a coupon code for the selected payment mode for the existing cart. This ensures the coupon's validity before proceeding with the payment process, enhancing user experience and preventing potential errors during transactions.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the cart.

parameters.name: buy_now
parameters.description: Whether to get buy_now cart.

parameters.name: address_id
parameters.description: ID allotted to an address.

parameters.name: payment_mode
parameters.description: Payment mode selected by the customer.

parameters.name: payment_identifier
parameters.description: Identifier of payment like ICIC, PAYTM.

parameters.name: aggregator_name
parameters.description: Payment gateway identifier.

parameters.name: merchant_code
parameters.description: Identifier used by payment gateway for a given payment mode, e.g. NB_ICIC, PAYTM.

parameters.name: iin
parameters.description: Debit/Credit card prefix (first 6 digit).

parameters.name: network
parameters.description: Credit/Debit card issuer, e.g. VISA, MASTERCARD, RUPAY.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Card type, e.g. Credit, Debit.

parameters.name: card_id
parameters.description: Saved card token reference id.

parameters.name: cart_type
parameters.description: Type of the cart.

200.description: Success. Returns a success message and the coupon validity. Refer `PaymentCouponValidate` for more details.

get.description: Get the current stock status for products identified by their IDs, such as SKU, ALU, EAN, etc.

parameters.name: item_id
parameters.description: The Item ID of the product (Max. 50 allowed).

parameters.name: alu
parameters.description: ALU of the product (limited upto 50 ALU identifier in a single request).

parameters.name: sku_code
parameters.description: Stock-keeping Unit of the product (limited upto 50 SKU Code in a single request).

parameters.name: ean
parameters.description: European Article Number of the product (limited upto 50 EAN identifier in a single request).

parameters.name: upc
parameters.description: Universal Product Code of the product (limited upto 50 UPC identifier in a single request).

200.description: Success. Returns the status of the product stock.Check the example shown below or refer `ProductStockStatusResponse` for more details.

get.description: List all products available in the catalog. It supports filtering based on product name, brand, department, category, collection, and more, while also offering sorting options based on factors like price, ratings, discounts, and other relevant criteria.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: The search query for entering partial or full name of product, brand, category, or collection.

parameters.name: f
parameters.description: The search filter parameters. Filter parameters will be passed in f parameter as shown in the example below. Double Pipe (||) denotes the OR condition, whereas Triple-colon (:::) indicates a new filter parameter applied as an AND condition.

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description: True for fetching all filter parameters and False for disabling the filter parameters.

parameters.name: sort_on
parameters.description: The order in which the list of products should be sorted, e.g. popularity, price, latest and discount, in either ascending or descending order. See the supported values below.

parameters.name: page_id
parameters.description: Page ID to retrieve next set of results.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of items to retrieve in each page.

parameters.name: page_no
parameters.description: The page number to navigate through the given set of results.

parameters.name: page_type
parameters.description: Available pagination types are cursor or number.

200.description: Success. Returns a paginated list of products..Check the example shown below or refer `ProductListingResponse` for more details.

4XX.description: Bad request. See the error object in the response body to know the exact reason.

get.description: Get a list of all the available brands. Filtering can be applied to the department.

parameters.name: department
parameters.description: The name of the department. Use this parameter to filter products by a particular department. See the list of available departments below. Also, you can get available departments from the endpoint /service/application/catalog/v1.0/departments/.

parameters.name: page_no
parameters.description: The page number to navigate through the given set of results.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of items to retrieve in each page.

Category or classification of the address. The address_category field 
that includes "store", "delivery", and "billing" serves to classify
addresses based on various business processes
- 'store': Identifies addresses associated with physical retail locations or warehouses which is essential for inventory management, order fulfillment, and facilitating in-store pickups or returns.
- 'delivery': Identifies addresses where orders are shipped to customers which ensures successful delivery, enhancing customer satisfaction, and optimizing logistics operations.
- 'billing': Identifies addresses used for billing and financial transactions which are essential for payment processing, invoice generation, and maintaining financial accuracy.

order_type.description:
Defines the specific journey a shipment will follow based on the application's operational needs and customer preferences. This field categorizes orders into distinct types, each associated with a unique processing flow. For example:
- "HomeDelivery": The order undergoes all state transitions typical for a delivery, from processing the shipment to final delivery at the customer's address.
- "PickAtStore": The order is prepared for pickup and moved to a state where it is ready to be handed over directly to the customer at the store. This type streamlines the process by bypassing traditional shipping stages and facilitating a quicker transition to the final handover stage.

ChargeDistributionSchema.description: Charge distribution structure, used to refer the distribution logic for the entity such as Order, shipment, article

type.description:
This field defines the distribution type, e.g values('multi', 'single')
  multi: distribute the changes across all entity
  single: distribute the changes across to any one single entity

logic.description:
This field defines the distribution logic e.g values('apportion', 'equally') apportion: distribute charge amount based of weighted average amount of all the entity (like article with
           [10, 20] will get charge of 9 as [3, 6])
equally: distribute charge amount 'equally' to all the entity

promotion_type.description: Specifies the type of discount or deal applied to the current promotion, defining how the promotion modifies the price or adds value to the purchase. Each type represents a different promotional strategy - percentage- Discount by a percentage of the original price. - amount- Discount by a specific amount off the original price. - fixed_price- Sets the price to a specific fixed amount. - bogo- Buy One Get One or at a discount. - contract_price- Special pricing based on a contract or agreement. - shipping_price- Discount or deal related to the shipping cost. - ladder_price- Price changes based on quantity purchased. - bundle_price_percentage- Discount on a bundle purchase by a percentage. - bundle_price_amount- Discount on a bundle purchase by a specific amount. - bundle_amount_percentage- A percentage of the purchase amount is applied as a discount when buying in a bundle. - custom- A custom promotion not covered by other types. - free_gift_items- Free gift items are included with the purchase. - free_non_sellable_items- Free items that are not for sale are included with the purchase.

qc_type.description: List of QC (Quality Control) types -- having return reason types indicating the stage at which QC is performed. - "Doorstep QC" refers to the quality control checks that occur at the customer's doorstep. This could be part of a delivery process where the product is inspected for any damages, defects, or discrepancies in the presence of the customer before the final handover. - "Pre QC" represents a proactive quality control approach where the customer plays an active role in the QC process before the product is collected for return or exchange. In this procedure, customers are required to upload photos of the product for a preliminary quality check by the operations team. Approval from this team is necessary before a delivery partner is dispatched to pick up the product. This innovative method ensures that the product meets return or exchange criteria, streamlining the process for both the customer and the operations team, and minimizing unnecessary logistics movements.
